This is the OCR-ed text from Garufi: the collation on the manuscript has not yet been done.

quotation.p: The manuscript does not have quotation marks. Some passages (direct speech or epistle quotations) are marked up with 'said', without quotation marks.

Quotations from literary works are marked up with 'quote'. When present, @type="biblia" means that it is a biblical quote, according to the "Manuale di codifica dei testi ALIM in TEI XML" in http://it.alim.unisi.it/documentazione/. @type="liturgia" means that the quote comes from the Catholic liturgy.

namespace.name: http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0

list.item: When it has @type="subst" (and it is child of 'subst' and sibling of 'del') it is meant to substitute the textual portion marked with 'del'. Otherwise, it represents an addition to the text.
If no @hand attribute is provided, it is implied that the the main hand of the manuscript is responsible for the textual modification. If another hand is responsible, a @hand attribute is provided.

namespace.tagUsage:
See above the note on the usage of 'link'. Like 'link', also 'anchor' has @type="transposition". Element 'anchor' has the same values of @subtype as the 'link' that points to it: it marks the point of the text at which a paragraph is collocated
by both the editions of Garufi and Bonetti (if @subtype="garufiandbonetticollocation"),
by Garufi only (if @subtype="garuficollocation"), or
by Bonetti only (if @subtype="bonetticollocation")

list.item: It is used either alone for a passage deleted and not substituted by the scribe,or in combination with 'subst' and 'add'.

Possible values for @rend: "rasura", "strikeout"; when used with 'subst' and 'add', also "metamark" (when a scribe wrote a metamark such as an asterisk above the original text as a pointer towards a correction added in margin), "nomark" (when the correction is simply rewritten on the original glyphs or the correction is made by deleting a part of a glyph), and "glyphmodification" (when a scribe transforms a glyph to another glyph by erasing a part of it).
If no @hand attribute is provided, it is implied that the the main hand of the manuscript is responsible for the textual modification. If another hand is responsible, a @hand attribute is provided.

namespace.tagUsage: Used to mark up words capitalized in the print edition, but not constituting proper noun, such as "Sed" at the beginning of a sentence.

With @type="transposition", it links a paragraph (first teidata.pointer in the value) of the manuscript text to an 'ancho'r (second teidata.pointer in the value) marking the point of the text in which that paragraph is collocated
by both the editions of Garufi and Bonetti (if @subtype="garufiandbonetticollocation"),
by Garufi only (if @subtype="garuficollocation"), or
by Bonetti only (if @subtype="bonetticollocation")

list.item: With @type="bonetti_is_collation_exemplar_from_here_on" it marks the point of the text rom which I used the file with the OCR of the Bonetti edition as a collation base. Before that point, I had used the OCR of the Garufi edition as base.
With @type="no-par-break-in-bonetti-between-this-garufi-par-and-previous-one" and @ed="#b" it is put at a point of the text in which Garufi has a paragraph break but Bonetti does not.
With @type="bonetti-paragraph-break" and @ed="#b" it is put at a point of the text in which Bonetti has a paragraph break but Garufi does not.

prefixDef.p: In the context of this edition, private URIs with the prefix "vat" point to a specific page of external PDF file vat.lat.3973.pdf, including the digital images of the A manuscript. For example, "vat:29" dereferences to "img/vat.lat.3973.pdf#page=29".

handNote.p: A part of the text was missing from manuscript A, so two additional folios were added at a much later time, probably in the XVII century, and then numbered as 204 and 205.
A marginal note at the top right corner of folio 204r says: "hae duo paginae, quae hic deerant, desumptae sunt de codices Petri de Urbe".
So pages 204r, 204v, 205r, 205v do not constitute a witness of the text of codex A. Still, I am transcribing their text here for completeness.
This hand is also responsible for corrections and additions passim in the manuscript.

Also this hand has a glyph for the 'e caudatum'. Since this is an alphabetic (not graphematic )transcription, I am encoding it with its alphabetic correspondent 'ae' and marking those 'ae' alphabemes with seg ana="#ae".

text.body: [p xml:id="g3.1-3.1"] [/p] [p xml:id="g3.2-3.6"] Prima mundi etas est ab Adam usque ad diluuium, continens annos, iuxta hebraicam ueritatem, mille sexcentos quinquaginta sex, iuxta Septuaginta uero interpretes duo milia ducentos quadraginta duos; generationes uero iuxta utramque editionem numero decem, que uniuersali est deleta diluuio, sicut primam cuiusque hominis obliuio demergere consueuit etatem. [/p] [p xml:id="g3.7-3.16"] [/p] [p xml:id="g3.17-4.2"] Secunda etas a Noe usque ad Abraam generationes iuxta hebraicam ueritatem complexa decem, annos autem ducentos nonaginta duos. Porro iuxta Septuaginta interpretes anni MLXXII. Generationes uero XI. hec uero quasi pueritia fuit generationis populi Dei. Et ideo in lingua inuenta est hebrea. A pueritia namque homo incipit nosse loqui, que idcirco appellata est, quod fari non potest. Ab Adam itaque usque ad Abraham iuxta hebraicam ueritatem computantur anni mille nungenti quadraginta octo, secundum Septuaginta interpretes fiunt anni tria milia trecenti XIV. [/p] [p xml:id="g4.3-4.10"] Tertia ab Abraham usque ad Dauid, generationes iuxta utramque auctoritatem XIII annos uero, secundum Hebreorum auctoritatem nungentos quadraginta duos complectens; iuxta Septuaginta uero interpretes anni tria milia C XXXVII. Hec uelud quedam adolescentia fuit populi Dei, a qua etate incipit homo posse generare, propterea Matheus euangelista generationum ab Abraham sumpsit exordium, qui etiam pater multarum gentium constitutus est, quando mutatum nomen accepit. Ab Adam uero iuxta Hebreorum auctoritatem usque ad Dauid fiunt anni duo milia octingenti nonaginta, secundum Septuaginta interpretes tria milia CV. Cur autem annorum hec diuersitas sit, in sequentibus ostendetur. [/p] [p xml:id="g4.11-4.17"] Quarta a Dauid usque ad transmigrationem Babilonis annos habens, iuxta hebraicam ueritatem, CDLXXIII, iuxta uero Septuaginta translationem XII amplius generationes iuxta utrosque codices XVII, quas tamen euangelista Matheus certi misterii gratia XIV ponit a qua uelud iuuenili etati populo Dei regum tempora ceperunt; hec namque in hominibus etas apta gubernando solet existere regno. Ab exordio autem prime etatis, usque ad trasmigrationem Babilonis computantur anni tria milia CCCLXXIII secundum Hebreorum auctoritatem, iuxta LXX uero interpretes anni tria milia quingenti nonaginta. [/p] [p xml:id="g4.18-4.25"] Quinta quasi senilis etas a transmigratione Babilonis usque in aduentum Domini Saluatoris in carne. Generationibus et ipsa XIV. Porro annis, secundum Hebreorum auctoritatem, quingentis octoginta IX extenta; iuxta Septuaginta autem annis quingentis Septuaginta VIII, in qua graue senectute fessa malis crebrioribus plebs hebrea quassatur. Taliter itaque ab exordio temporum usque ad incarnationem Christi Domini secundum Hebreorum auctoritatem prosequente beato Ieronimo fiunt anni tria milia CMLII. Uerum iuxta Septuaginta interpretes, quos omnino Greci secuntur, numerantur anni VDVIII. Eusebius autem, quem Orosius secutus est, inter utrosque numerat annos VCXCIX quibus pene omnes latini utuntur. [/p] [p xml:id="g4.26-5.2"] Sexta etas, que nunc agitur, nulla generationum, uel teporum serie certa, sed ut etas decrepita, ipsa totius seculi morte comsumenda: has erumpnosas, plenasque laboribus mundi etates, quique beati felici morte uicerunt septimam iam sabbati perhennis etatem suscepti, octauam beate resurrectionis etatem, in qua semper cum Domino regnent, expectant. [/p] [p xml:id="g5.3-5.10"] Etas quippe duobus modis dicitur: aut enim hominis, sicut a natiuitate infantia usque in annos septem, pueritia usque ad annos quattuordecim, adolescentia a quinto decimo usque in uicesimum octauum, iuuentus usque ad XLIX, senectus a quinquagesimo usque ad LXXIX, decrepita ab anno octogesimo quousque uita finitur. Aut mundi, cuius prima etas ab Adam usque ad Noe, secunda a Noe usque ad Abraham, tertia ab Abraham usque ad Dauid, quarta a Dauid usque ad captiuitatem Iudeorum in Babiloniam, quinta deinde usque ad aduentum Saluatoris, sexta, que nunc est usque quo mundus iste finiatur, quarum decursus per generationes, et regna euidentius infra, prout inuenire potui, explicabo. [/p] [p xml:id="g5.11-5.18"] Creator omnium uisibilium et inuisibilium, qui trinus et unus Deus est, in principio creauit celum et terram, mare, et omnia, que in eis sunt, tempora quoque instituit, nam prima die in lucis nomine condidit angelos, secunda die in discretionis uocabulo speciem aquarum, quarta luminaria celi, uidelicet solem, et lunam, et stellas, que temporum sunt ordinationes, quinta animantia ex aquis, sexta animantia ex terra, et hominem, quem appellauit Adam, et posuit in paradiso, cuius de latere dormientis costam tollens, mulierem edificauit, ut eius adiutorio genus propagaret humanum, septima autem die requieuit Deus ab omni opere prime ac noue conditionis; hoc autem secundum licteram. [/p] [p xml:id="g5.19-5.19"] Incipit prima etas. [/p] [p xml:id="g5.20-5.25"] Primo igitur anno, postquam de paradiso Adam ligni uetiti culpa proiectus est, cognouit uxorem suam genuitque Cayn, deinde Abel, quorum unus, uidelicet Abel, iustus simplex ac innocens fuit et Deo placens, ideoque iustus. Cain uero superbus, inuidus, ac nocens, et Deo displicens, ideoque iniustus, qui sola inuidia fratrem occidit. Unde et fratricide Deus iratus, maledictionem intulit, eiusque progeniem execratus est, atque ex eo filii hominum dicti sunt. [/p] [p xml:id="g5.26-5.32"] Adam uero cum CXXX esset annorum, genuit filium, nomine Seth. Hic fuit uir bonus, et iustus, de cuius prosapia homines exorti, filii Dei dicti sunt. Superuixit autem Adam, postquam genuit Seth, annis DCCC secundum hebraicam ueritatem, usque ad quinquagesimum sextum annum natiuitatis Lamech. Uerum Septuaginta interpretes ante natum Seth posuere annos CCCXXX, postea DCC. Seth interpretatur resurrectio, significans resurrectionem Christi a mortuis, cuius mortem illatam a Iudeis significat Abel, qui dicitur iustus, a fratre Cain occisus, secundum Septuaginta, annum CCCXXXV, secundum Hebreos CCXXXV. [/p] [p xml:id="g6.1-6.6"] Seth habens annos CV genuit Enos, cui superuixit annos DCCCXVI usque ad CLXVII annum natiuitatis Lamech, porro Septuaginta interpretes ante natum Enos annos CCV postea posuere annos DCCVII. Enos interpretatur homo, de quo Deus benedicitur, iste cepit inuocare nomen Domini, quia hominum est proprium, ut suae fragilitatis memores, inuocent conditoris auxilium, eorum dumtaxat, qui in fide Christi uiuentes, filii resurrectionis sic esse letantur, secundum septuaginta, annum DCXXV, Hebrei CCCXXV. [/p] [p xml:id="g6.7-6.10"] Enos habens annos XC genuit Cainan, cui superuixit annos DCCCXV secundum Hebreos, idest usque ad LXXXIV annum natiuitatis Noe, sed Septuaginta interpretes ante natum Cainan CXC annos, postea DCCXV posuere, secundum LXX annum DCCXXV iuxta Hebreos CCCXCV. [/p] [p xml:id="g6.11-6.13"] Cainan habens annos LXX genuit Malalehel, post cuius ortum uixit annos DCCCXL id est usque ad CLXXIX annum natiuitatis Noe; Septuaginta interpretes ante natum Malalehel CLXX postea dixere DCCXL, secundum septuaginta annum CMXCV iuxta Hebreos CDLX. [/p] [p xml:id="g6.14-1.16"] Malalehel annorum LXV genuit Iareth, cui superuixit annos DCCCXXX usque ad CCXXXIV annum natiuitatis Noe; Septuaginta uero ante natum Iareth CLXV postea posuere DCCXXX. septuaginta annos MCXXII, Hebreos DCXXII. [/p] [p xml:id="g6.17-6.25"] Iareth annorum CLXII genuit Enoch, cui superuixit annis DCCC usque ad CCCLXVI annum natiuitatis Noe. In hac generatione nusquam codices discrepant. Hunc Enoch non nulla diuina scripsisse Iuda apostolo attestante comperimus. Sed ut beatus Agustinus dicit: non frustra non sunt in eo canones scripturarum, qui seruabantur in templo hebrei populi succedentium diligentia sacerdotum, nisi quia ob antiquitatem suspecte fidei iudicata sunt, nec uerum esse, quae ille scripsisse poterat inuenire, unde illa, quae sub eius nomine proferunt, et comtinet illas de gigantibus fabulas, quod non habuerint homines patres, recte a prudentibus iudicantur non ipsius esse credenda. Septuaginta MDCCLXXXVII, Hebrei DCLXXXVII. [/p]
